pullRequest.body:
* Make it work for a `UniformSpace` with extra properties.
* Use it to golf some instances.

Co-authored-by: @ADedecker 

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: :v: urkud can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8308085188/job/22737935800)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8308085188/job/22737935396)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8308085188/job/22737935671)

I thought it was a bit sad not to keep the original sketch of the proof, which is a bit more natural in my opinion (and makes it clear why we need some separation, to ensure that the diagonal is closed in the product). So I played a bit with it, and ended up with this version (for which you need to import `UniformEmbedding`):
```lean
-- move to top of file
open Function

-- move somewhere else
theorem Function.range_const_eq_diagonal {  : Type*} [h : Nonempty ] :
    Set.range (const ) = {f :    |  x y, f x = f y} := by
  refine Set.range_eq_iff _ _ |>.mpr fun _ _ _  rfl, fun f hf  ?_
  rcases isEmpty_or_nonempty  with h|a
   exact h.elim fun b  b, Subsingleton.elim _ _
   exact f a, funext fun x  hf _ _

/- An infimum of complete uniformities is complete, as long as the whole family is bounded by
some common T2 topology. -/
theorem CompleteSpace.iInf { : Type*} {X : Type*} {u :   UniformSpace X} {t : TopologicalSpace X}
    (hu :  i, @CompleteSpace X (u i)) (ht : @T2Space X t)
    (hut :  i, (u i).toTopologicalSpace  t) :
    @CompleteSpace X ( i, u i) := by
  -- We can assume `X` is nonempty.
  nontriviality X
  -- The diagonal map `(X,  i, u i)   i, (X, u i)` is a uniform embedding.
  have : @UniformInducing X (  X) ( i, u i) (Pi.uniformSpace (U := u)) (const ) := by
    simp_rw [uniformInducing_iff_uniformSpace, Pi.uniformSpace_eq,
      UniformSpace.comap_iInf,  UniformSpace.comap_comap]
    exact iInf_congr fun _  congrFun uniformSpace_comap_id _
  -- Hence, it suffices to show that its range, the diagonal, is closed in ` i, (X, u i)`.
  simp_rw [@completeSpace_iff_isComplete_range _ _ (_) (_) _ this, range_const_eq_diagonal,
    Set.setOf_forall]
  -- The separation of `t` ensures that this is the case in ` i, (X, t)`, hence the result
  -- since the topology associated to each `u i` is finer than `t`.
  have : Pi.topologicalSpace (t := fun i  (u i).toTopologicalSpace) 
         Pi.topologicalSpace (t := fun _  t) :=
    iInf_mono fun i  induced_mono <| hut i
  refine IsClosed.isComplete <| .mono ?_ this
  exact isClosed_iInter fun i  isClosed_iInter fun j 
    isClosed_eq (continuous_apply _) (continuous_apply _)
```

Note that I made the statement a bit stronger (the T2 topology which bounds everything doesn't have to come from a complete uniform structure) and probably easier to use, and even if you keep your original sketch of proof you can definitely do the same strengthening.

It looks a bit longer because of the comments, but adapting your proof to the same statement gives exactly the same length. As I said I find this one a bit more natural but this is probably a matter of taste.
Thanks! I replaced my proof with yours. It changes `{ : Sort*}` to `{ : Type*}` but I don't think that we should care in this case.
could you rename the instance to something more sensible? I don't think we should add deprecated versions for instances, as they will just make instance search slower.
